name: Fever
questions: Is your body temperature above 100°F (38°C)?
Do you feel chills or shivering?
Are you sweating excessively?
Do you have general body aches or weakness?
advice: Stay hydrated, rest well, and monitor your temperature regularly. If the fever persists for more than 3 days, consult a doctor.

name: Common Cold and Cough
questions: Do you have a runny or blocked nose?
Have you lost your sense of taste or smell?
Are you experiencing a sore throat?
Do you have a mild fever?
Are you sneezing frequently?
advice: Rest, drink warm fluids, use saline nasal spray, and avoid cold air.

name: Influenza (Flu)
questions: Is your fever above 100°F (38°C)?
Do you have muscle aches or chills?
Are you feeling very weak or fatigued?
Are you coughing frequently without mucus?
advice: Stay home, rest well, drink fluids, and monitor temperature regularly.
medicines: Paracetamol, Ibuprofen, Antiviral drugs (Tamiflu if prescribed).

name: COVID-19
questions: Do you have a persistent dry cough?
Have you lost your sense of taste or smell?
Are you feeling breathless or having difficulty breathing?
Have you recently been in contact with a COVID-positive person?
advice: Isolate, monitor oxygen levels, stay hydrated, and consult a doctor.
medicines: Paracetamol, Zinc, Vitamin C, prescribed antiviral or antibiotics.

name: Throat Infection
questions: Is it painful to swallow?
Are your tonsils swollen or red?
Do you see any white patches on your throat?
Do you have a fever?
advice: Gargle with salt water, avoid spicy foods, stay hydrated.

name: Gastritis
questions: Are you feeling a burning sensation in the stomach?
Do you feel bloated after meals?
Do you often burp or feel acidic?
Are you experiencing nausea or vomiting?
advice: Eat bland food, avoid spicy/oily food, don’t lie down after eating.

name: Constipation
questions: Have you had difficulty passing stools?
Do you feel bloated or have gas?
How many days since your last normal bowel movement?
Do you eat fiber-rich food regularly?
advice: Increase fiber and fluid intake, exercise regularly.

name: Asthma
questions: Do you often feel short of breath or wheeze while breathing?
Does your chest feel tight, especially during physical activity?
Do you have a history of asthma or allergies?
Do you cough frequently at night or early morning?
advice: Avoid allergens, use inhalers regularly, and follow asthma action plan.

name: Anxiety
questions: Do you frequently feel nervous or anxious without a clear reason?
Are you having trouble sleeping or relaxing?
Do you experience rapid heartbeat or sweating during stressful situations?
Is it affecting your daily life or routine?
advice: Practice deep breathing, mindfulness, and avoid caffeine and screens before bed.
medicines: Low-dose benzodiazepines (if prescribed), SSRIs, natural calming supplements.

name: Back Pain
questions: Is the pain located in your lower or upper back?
Did the pain start after lifting or bending?
Does it get worse after prolonged sitting or standing?
Do you feel numbness or tingling in your legs?
advice: Maintain posture, avoid heavy lifting, apply warm compress.

name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
questions: Do you feel a burning sensation while urinating?
Are you needing to urinate very frequently?
Do you feel pressure or pain in the lower abdomen?
Is your urine cloudy or foul-smelling?
advice: Drink plenty of water, avoid holding urine for long, maintain hygiene.

name: Hypertension (High BP)
questions: Has your blood pressure been measured recently?
Do you often feel dizzy or light-headed?
Are you experiencing frequent headaches?
Do you feel any discomfort in your chest or neck area?
advice: Reduce salt intake, exercise regularly, avoid stress.

name: Diabetes
questions: Do you often feel excessively thirsty or hungry?
Are you urinating more frequently than usual?
Have you noticed sudden weight loss without dieting?
Do you feel tired or weak frequently?
advice: Monitor blood sugar regularly, eat low-carb meals, exercise daily.

name: Depression
questions: Have you been feeling sad or hopeless most of the day?
Have you lost interest in activities you used to enjoy?
Do you have trouble sleeping or oversleeping?
Have you experienced thoughts of self-harm or worthlessness?
advice: Talk to someone you trust, follow a routine, get sunlight exposure.

name: Typhoid
questions: Have you had a persistent fever for more than 3 days?
Are you experiencing abdominal pain or discomfort?
Do you feel extremely weak or tired?
Are you having irregular bowel movements?
advice: Eat light, soft food; drink boiled water; take complete rest.

name: Chickenpox
questions: Do you have itchy red spots or fluid-filled blisters on your body?
Did you have a mild fever before the rash appeared?
Are the blisters spreading to arms, legs, and face?
Have you been in contact with anyone recently infected?
advice: Isolate until scabs form, avoid scratching, and rest.

name: Acidity (GERD)
questions: Do you feel a burning sensation in your chest, especially after meals?
Do you often burp or have a sour taste in your mouth?
Is the discomfort worse when lying down or at night?
Do you feel bloated after eating?
advice: Avoid spicy/oily food, eat small meals, don’t lie down immediately after eating.

name: Ear Infection
questions: Do you have pain or discomfort in your ear?
Is there any discharge or fluid coming out of your ear?
Are you having trouble hearing properly?
Do you have a fever or feel pressure in your ear?
advice: Keep the ear dry, avoid inserting anything, and consult a doctor if fever persists.

name: Menstrual Cramps
questions: Are you currently menstruating or expecting your period?
Do you feel pain or cramping in your lower abdomen?
Is the pain radiating to your lower back or thighs?
Are you also feeling tired, nauseous, or bloated?
advice: Use a hot water bag, stay hydrated, and rest. Gentle exercise may help.

name: Toothache
questions: Do you feel sharp pain in any particular tooth?
Is the tooth sensitive to hot or cold items?
Do your gums bleed while brushing?
Is there any swelling or visible cavity?
advice: Avoid hard foods, rinse with warm salt water, maintain oral hygiene.

name: Allergic Rhinitis
questions: Do you sneeze frequently, especially in the morning?
Are your eyes itchy, watery, or red?
Do you have a runny or blocked nose?
Is your throat irritated due to dripping mucus?
advice: Avoid allergens like dust/pollen, use air filters, and wash face after going outside.

name: Sinusitis
questions: Do you have facial pressure or pain, especially around the nose and eyes?
Are you experiencing nasal congestion or thick mucus?
Do you feel tired or have a low-grade fever?
Is the pain worse when you lean forward?
advice: Use steam inhalation, stay hydrated, and avoid sudden temperature changes.

name: Food Poisoning
questions: Did your symptoms start after eating outside or unfamiliar food?
Are you experiencing nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea?
Do you have abdominal pain or cramping?
Do you have a low or high fever?
advice: Drink ORS, avoid solid food until vomiting stops, and rest.

name: Migraine
questions: Do you experience one-sided or throbbing headaches?
Do you feel nauseated or vomit during headaches?
Are you sensitive to light or sound?
Do you see flashes or patterns before the headache starts?
advice: Rest in a quiet dark room, avoid known triggers, maintain sleep schedule.

name: Skin Allergy
questions: Do you have itchy or irritated skin?
Have you noticed any red rashes or bumps?
Is your skin swollen or dry in certain areas?
Have you used any new products or foods recently?
advice: Avoid allergens, keep skin moisturized, and wear loose cotton clothes.
medicines: Antihistamines, Calamine lotion, Topical steroids (if severe).

name: Arthritis
questions: Do you experience joint pain, especially in the morning?
Are your joints swollen or stiff?
Is it difficult to move certain joints fully?
Do you feel tired easily with physical activity?
advice: Do low-impact exercises, maintain healthy weight, and apply heat/cold packs.

name: Anemia
questions: Do you feel tired or weak most of the time?
Have you noticed paleness in your face or hands?
Do you feel dizzy when you stand or walk?
Are you experiencing shortness of breath or rapid heartbeat?
advice: Eat iron-rich foods like spinach, jaggery, and lentils; avoid tea with meals.
medicines: Iron supplements, Folic acid, Vitamin B12 (if needed).

name: Jaundice
questions: Have your eyes or skin turned yellow?
Is your urine darker than usual?
Do you have pale or clay-colored stools?
Are you feeling weak or having pain in the upper right abdomen?
advice: Avoid fatty foods, take adequate rest, and stay hydrated.

name: Eye Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
questions: Are your eyes red and watery?
Do you feel itching or irritation in your eyes?
Is there any sticky discharge, especially in the morning?
Do your eyes feel sensitive to bright light?
advice: Avoid touching eyes, wash hands frequently, and use clean towels.
medicines: Lubricating drops, Antibiotic eye drops (e.g., Moxifloxacin).

name: Dengue Fever
questions: Do you have high fever along with severe body pain?
Are you experiencing headaches behind the eyes?
Have you noticed skin rash or bleeding gums?
Has a recent test shown a drop in platelet count?
advice: Drink plenty of fluids,avoid painkillers like ibuprofen, take complete rest, and monitor platelet levels.
medicines: Paracetamol (avoid aspirin/NSAIDs), IV fluids if necessary.

name: Typhoid Fever
questions: Are you experiencing persistent high fever for several days?
Do you feel extremely weak or tired?
Do you have abdominal pain or discomfort?
Have you noticed any change in bowel habits (constipation or diarrhea)?
advice: Eat soft, digestible food, avoid raw fruits/vegetables, and complete antibiotic course.

name: Scabies
questions: Are you experiencing severe itching that gets worse at night?
Do you have small red bumps or blisters on your skin?
Is the itching spreading to family members or close contacts?
Have you noticed thread-like burrow marks on wrists, waist, or fingers?
advice: Wash clothes and bedding in hot water, avoid skin contact with others.
